title: Padma Lakshmi Is Transforming How Americans Think About Food
description: One of the best meals Top Chef alum Padma Lakshmi has ever eaten is Kabuli pulao—an aromatic rice dish, cooked with lamb, carrots and raisins—alongside members of the Afghan American community in Washington, D.C. She spoke with them about helping evacuees arriving after the Taliban’s 2021 takeover of Kabul, as well as how to get…

title: How to Watch this Week’s Spectacular Geminid Meteor Shower
description: The year's most spectacular meteor shower begins Dec. 13. Here's what you should know.

title: Zelensky Doesn’t Appear to Convince Republicans on Ukraine Aid During Congress Visit
description: "I told President Zelensky, 'Here’s the problem: It’s got nothing to do with you.'"

title: Inside the Little-Known U.S. Arms Control Center in Daily Contact With Russia
description: The NNRRC was set up to reduce the chance of nuclear war. But as Russia pulls out of arms control deals, the risks grow ever greater.

title: What I’ve Seen Treating Patients in Gaza’s Remaining Hospitals
description: Patients with advanced gangrene that need amputations. A patient with burn wounds infested with worms. The humanitarian situation is dire.

title: The Constitution Is Not a Suicide Pact
description: The courts are right to say that former President Donald Trump isn't entitled to unfettered free speech in his legal cases.

title: Claudine Gay Will Remain Harvard President After Controversial Remarks
description: Harvard President Claudine Gay will remain leader of the school following her comments last week at a congressional hearing on antisemitism.

title: How the Endangered Species Act Saved America
description: Dan Flores explores the legacy of the Endangered Species Act 50 years later.

title: At Least 23 Dead in Suicide Blast in Northwestern Pakistan. Here’s What to Know
description: A gun and suicide bomb attack hit a police station in Dera Ismail Khan, in northwest Pakistan, on Tuesday. Here's what to know.

title: Exclusive: Conversion Therapy Is Still Happening in Almost Every U.S. State
description: Practitioners are currently working in almost every U.S. state.

title: Puma Terminates Sponsorship of Israel’s National Soccer Team. Here’s What to Know
description: The German sportswear brand says the decision was taken as part of a new "fewer-bigger-better" business strategy. Here's what to know.

title: 5 Key Takeaways From the New Netflix World Cup Series Under Pressure
description: A behind-the-scenes look at the U.S. women's national soccer team

title: The Kids Who Sued Montana Over Climate Change and Won Say It’s Just The Start
description: For the young plaintiffs in the landmark environmental case, victory was “a great first step” for climate action.

title: Zelensky’s Hasty Visit Shows How MAGA Republicans Have Captured US Foreign Policy
description: The Ukrainian leader's push for more aid is tied with funds for Israel and Taiwan.

title: Israel and U.S. Face Growing Isolation as Deadly War in Gaza Continues With No End in Sight
description: Israel, backed by the U.S., has pressed ahead with its offensive against Hamas that has left more than 18,000 Palestinians killed and could still go on for months more.

title: Why Colombia’s President is Determined to Ditch the Country’s Oil Wealth
description: Gustavo Petro, Colombia's president, is positioning the country as a case study for how state built on fossil-fuel wealth can decarbonize.

title: Missile Strikes Oil Tanker off Yemen’s Coast Amid Growing Threat Posed by Houthi Rebels
description: The assault on the Norwegian-flagged tanker expands a campaign by the Iranian-backed rebels into apparently now striking ships that have no clear ties to Israel.

title: Civil-War-Torn Myanmar Surpasses Afghanistan as World’s Top Opium Producer
description: The Southeast Asian country's opium output has topped that of Afghanistan, where the ruling Taliban imposed a ban on its production.

title: Japanese Former Soldiers Found Guilty in Landmark Sexual Assault Case
description: Gonoi, 24, took the rare step of going public with her accusations—drawing widespread attention globally and in Japan, where victims of such crimes rarely speak out against their assailants.

title: China’s Xi Makes First Visit to Vietnam in Years to Counter U.S. Influence
description: When Chinese President Xi Jinping makes his first trip to Vietnam in six years, he’ll be seeking to ensure a strategically important Asian partner hasn’t drifted too close to the U.S.
